q: Barbara Walters says she spent most of the time after the initial diagnosis trying to deny she needed the surgery. Perhaps, she says, she was hoping doctors would find a new, less invasive process. I had heard some horrendous things about it. You're in agony, and then you'll be depressed, she says. no surprise in the Simon Cowell that Rushfield presents, but he does bring him to life-- by turns brilliant and exasperating, self-serving and disarmingly honest. Rushfield sums him up well: If ever a person could be prepared for fame and all that came with it, it was Simon Cowell ... For 20 years, Simon Cowell had been involved in every aspect of the shadowy business of creating stars... He had seen how the magical alchemy could transform people into stars, and he had seen how it could go wrong.
